I do not recommend this in any way to anyone who hasn't touched this game before, stay far away.

This game is so versatile and not in a positive way, missiles are inconsistent, radar is inconsistent, planes are inconsistent. EVERYTHING IN THIS GAME WILL CHANGE FROM MATCH TO MATCH.

It's just pure luck at this point and the developers seem to have no priority other than to pump out updates that will break the game further.
Not only that but they push premium vehicles in your face till you buy them, making them seem great on paper but yet when you use them in such a way, you get no where.

The current matchmaking at top tier just consists of either an SU-30 or an F-14 just spamming missiles at you if you manage to evade those missiles, congrats.
The F-2 is now closing on your position, good luck.

Save your money, save your time, save your energy into a company that actually values you as a committed player instead of throwing dung in your face every time you try and show them the tiniest form of appreciation.

Great game that brings the reality of vehicle warfare (getting oneshot from a mile away or get spawn-bombed). Having 1000+ hrs of suffering on Asia server from a country with lagspikes frequent and sereve enough to kick you out of the match, I can tell you that much.
[b]Pros:[/b]  
- Non-existent skill cap. Lots of progression, tons of vehicles (literally) and you have to learn everything when you buy a new one.
- Arguably the most accurate warfare vehicle simulation right now, not too e-sporty although their e-sport scene is quite cool too.
- Arcade for fun(?) and fast match, realistic to hone your skills, simulation battle is for those who mastered the dark art.
- Free(?) to play, and having all armored, navy, and aerial gameplay in a single package is good. But I do hope we have combined mode featuring all 3 soon, maybe in 10 years. 
[b]Cons:[/b] 
- More servers and cross-server play would help this game so much. Or maybe make sure the server is good and robust enough to prevent lagspike from kicking players (me) out of the match and wasting my 150% exp boost.
- Progression is f**ked. EVERY vehicle needs to be researched for the most basic techs AGAIN on purchase, that uses exp, which is earned from playing matches with THAT vehicle. Which means suffering on a slow-ass hunk of steel with no penetration whatsoever. Oh, exp transfer you say? That ♥♥♥♥ is paywalled, or should I say, pay-well-ed, since the cost is based on the amount of 'premium' exp that you want to use, which turns it into a literal well for you to throw money into. Having said all that, don't get me started on the farm currency (SL) debacle.
- Premium vehicles. That can sometimes be OP on their BR. Yeah but it's not so bad. 
- Non-existent skill cap, which means you can still be dunked on even with 1k, or 10k hrs.

So YEAH, if you think you can enjoy the game with all that ♥♥♥♥, then it's free, try it.
